Package org.cesecore.audit.impl.log4j

Class Log4jDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.audit.impl.log4j.Log4jDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Auditable, AuditLogDevice, AuditLogger
    public class Log4jDevice
extends Object
implements AuditLogDevice
    Simple implementation of (secure) audit that writes all log to Log4J. This implementation does not comply to the CESeCore TSF regarding log protection and only provided as a compliment to monitor operations or for use in high performance environments where compliance is not an issue.
    Version:
    $Id: Log4jDevice.java 18374 2014-01-16 13:13:34Z anatom $

      • exportAuditLogs

        public AuditLogExportReport exportAuditLogs​(AuthenticationToken token,
                                            CryptoToken cryptoToken,
                                            Date timestamp,
                                            boolean deleteAfterExport,
                                            Map<String,​Object> signatureDetails,
                                            Properties properties,
                                            Class<? extends AuditExporter> c)
                                     throws AuditLogExporterException
        Description copied from interface: Auditable
        This operation is used to export a set logs.
        Specified by:
        exportAuditLogs in interface Auditable
        Parameters:
        token - user performing the task.
        cryptoToken - Crypto Token to be used.
        timestamp - Timestamp till which the logs will be exported.
        deleteAfterExport - Deletes the exported results if true.
        signatureDetails - Map containing signature details. (@see AuditLogBasicExporter public static varaibles).
        properties - properties to be passed on the device
        c - the exporter implementation to be used
        Returns:
        A extended validation report with the path to the exported file.
        Throws:
        AuditLogExporterException - if export fails

      • log

        public void log​(TrustedTime trustedTime,
                EventType eventType,
                EventStatus eventStatus,
                ModuleType module,
                ServiceType service,
                String authToken,
                String customId,
                String searchDetail1,
                String searchDetail2,
                Map<String,​Object> additionalDetails,
                Properties properties)
         throws AuditRecordStorageException
        Description copied from interface: AuditLogger
        Creates a signed log, stored in the database.
        Specified by:
        log in interface AuditLogger
        Parameters:
        trustedTime - TrustedTime instance will be used to get a trusted timestamp.
        eventType - The event log type.
        eventStatus - The status of the operation to log.
        module - The module where the operation took place.
        service - The service(application) that performed the operation.
        authToken - The authentication token that invoked the operation.
        customId - ID
        searchDetail1 - Search 1
        searchDetail2 - Search 2
        additionalDetails - Additional details to be logged.
        properties - properties to be passed on the device
        Throws:
        AuditRecordStorageException - if unable to store the log record

      • prepareReset

        public void prepareReset()
                  throws AuditLogResetException
        Description copied from interface: AuditLogDevice
        Prepares the secure audit log mechanism for reset. This method will block till all audit log processes are completed. Should be used with caution because once called audit log will not be operational. Any attempt to log will result in an exception.
        Specified by:
        prepareReset in interface AuditLogDevice
        Throws:
        AuditLogResetException - If reset fails

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws AuditLogResetException
        Description copied from interface: AuditLogDevice
        Resets all security audit events logger internal state. Once this method finishes the audit log will be available again. This method should be used with caution.
        Specified by:
        reset in interface AuditLogDevice
        Throws:
        AuditLogResetException - If reset fails
